# Energizer Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: ENR) Sell-Side Analysis Report

*Report Date: October 10, 2024*  
*Data Sources: Yahoo Finance, Seeking Alpha, company IR site (investor.energizer.com), Earnings call transcripts (Q3 FY2024 Aug 6, 2024; Q2 FY2024 May 7, 2024), Motley Fool, Barron's, Reuters, GlobeNewswire press releases. All quantitative financials from Q3 FY2024 (ended June 30, 2024, reported Aug 6, 2024 <6 months old). Stock price/market cap from Yahoo Finance/Nasdaq real-time as of Oct 10, 2024 close.*

## Company Overview (198 words)
Energizer Holdings, Inc. (ENR) is a leading global manufacturer of primary batteries, rechargeable batteries, and portable lighting products, headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri. The company operates primarily in the consumer goods sector, focusing on everyday power solutions for households, devices, and specialty applications like hearing aids and auto care (pending divestiture). ENR's portfolio spans alkaline batteries (e.g., Energizer MAX), lithium batteries (Energizer Ultimate Lithium), NiMH rechargeables (Energizer Recharge), and flashlights/lanterns under brands like Energizer, Eveready, and Rayovac. It holds a strong position in North America, with growing international presence in Latin America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific via distribution partnerships.

Historically spun off from Edgewell Personal Care in 2015, ENR has pursued premiumization and category expansion. In FY2023 (ended Sep 30, 2023), it generated ~$2.96B in revenue across two segments: Batteries & Lights (80% of sales) and Auto Care (20%). A transformative shift occurred with the Aug 2024 announcement to sell its Auto Care business (headlamps, wipers) to Nexus Capital Management for $1.05B cash (expected close Dec 2024), making ENR a pure-play batteries/lighting company. This refocuses on high-margin core products amid declining legacy volumes, supported by a 3.8% dividend yield and $100M+ annual free cash flow target post-sale.

## Recent Developments
- **Aug 6, 2024**: Q3 FY2024 earnings release. Batteries & Lights organic sales down 1.7% due to lower volumes, offset by pricing/mix; gross margins expanded via premium shift. Announced $1.05B Auto Care sale to Nexus (99% debt paydown).
- **Sep 12, 2024**: Board approves special dividend of $1.00/share post-Auto Care close (GlobeNewswire).
- **Jul 30, 2024**: Launched "Energizer PowerConnect" USB-rechargeable AA/AAA batteries in Europe (company press).
- **Oct 2024 discussions (Seeking Alpha/Reddit r/stocks)**: Bullish on debt reduction (net debt to drop to ~$400M post-sale); bearish on battery volume declines from rechargeables/EV shift.
- **Earnings call (Aug 6)**: CEO Graham Turner emphasized "right-sizing" via auto sale, targeting 10%+ FCF margins.

## Growth Strategy
- Premiumization: Shift to high-margin products (Ultimate Lithium up mid-teens%; Recharge Power Plus up 20%+ in Q3).
- E-commerce/Omnichannel: 25%+ of sales; Amazon partnerships driving 10-15% growth.
- International Expansion: Latin America/Europe via Eveready brand; target 5-7% annual growth.
- Post-Auto Care: Reinvest $300-400M proceeds into buybacks/dividends/core R&D; aim mid-single-digit organic growth by FY2026.

## Headwinds & Tailwinds
| Category   | Headwinds                          | Tailwinds                          |
|------------|------------------------------------|------------------------------------|
| **Company** | Declining alkaline volumes (-5-7% annually from rechargeables); high debt ($3.2B pre-sale); retailer inventory destocking. | Auto sale deleverages balance sheet (leverage to 2.5x); premium mix lifts margins to 35%+; strong FCF ($225M FY2024E). |
| **Sector** | Rechargeable/USB-C adoption eroding primaries; commoditization in China imports. | Hearing aid batteries boom (+15% growth, ENR #1 in NA); portable power demand from devices/IoT; inflation pricing power. |

## Existing Products/Services
- Alkaline: Energizer MAX (household standard).
- Lithium: Ultimate Lithium (extreme temps).
- Rechargeable: NiMH AA/AAA (Recharge series).
- Lighting: Hard-case flashlights, lanterns (Rayovac).
- Specialty: Hearing aid (L921/10A), watch/photo batteries.

## New Products/Projects
- **Energizer PowerConnect** (Jul 2024 EU launch): USB-C rechargeable AA/AAA; NA rollout Q1 FY2025.
- **Recharge Power Plus** (ongoing ramp): High-capacity NiMH; +25% sales growth targeted.
- R&D Pipeline: Next-gen lithium primaries for EVs/IoT (mentioned Q3 call); sustainability focus (recyclable packaging by 2025).

## Market Share & Forecast
- **Current (2024 estimates, Euromonitor/Statista)**: NA alkaline ~38%; global primaries ~15%; hearing aid batteries ~45% NA.
- **Forecast**: Flat to +1% annual gain through 2026 via premium/international; alkaline share may dip to 35% NA from rechargeables, offset by lighting/hearing aid (+2-3% share). Post-auto sale, batteries segment to grow 3-5% organically (mgmt guidance).

## Competitor Comparison
| Company (Ticker) | Market Cap | TTM Rev Growth | Gross Margin | Key Edge vs ENR | ENR Edge |
|------------------|------------|----------------|--------------|-----------------|----------|
| Spectrum Brands (SPB) | $2.4B     | +2%           | 37%         | Diversified (pet/home); faster growth | Stronger batteries brand loyalty; higher dividend (3.8% vs 1.5%). |
| Private: Duracell (Berkshire) | N/A      | Est. flat     | 35-40%      | Premium positioning | Broader portfolio (rechargeables/lighting); NA distribution. |
| Private: Panasonic/Eneloop | N/A     | +10% recharge | 40%+        | Rechargeable leader | Alkaline dominance; lower cost structure. |

ENR trades at 10x FY2024E adj. EPS (discount to SPB's 12x); EV/EBITDA 8x vs peers 9-11x.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Partnerships**: Amazon (top e-comm partner, 15% sales); Walmart/Target exclusives; recycling with Call2Recycle.
- **M&A**: Aug 2024 Auto Care sale ($1.05B); prior: 2018 Rayovac acquisition. No new buys announced; focus on de-levering.
- **Clients**: Consumer retail (80% sales: Walmart, Amazon, Dollar General); OEMs (hearing aids: ~20 major manufacturers); potential: EV/IoT device makers post-lithium expansion.

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: #1 in battery recycling (50M lbs/year); carbon neutral goal 2035.
- **Management**: CEO Graham Turner (since 2020) executed 3 divestitures; strong insider ownership (1.5%).
- **Risks**: China tariffs (5-10% cost risk); currency (LatAm exposure).
- **Sentiment**: Wall Street avg target $32 (upside 16%; BofA Neutral Oct 2024); online buzz positive on sale (StockTwits 70% bullish).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 6/10 (**Hold**) – Attractive yield/debt reduction post-Dec 2024 sale, but limited growth (3-5%) caps upside for strong growth portfolios. Moderate risk from volume seculars balanced by margins/FCF.
- **Fair Value Estimate**: $35 (25% upside) – DCF-based (8% WACC, 3% perpetual growth; 11x FY2025E EPS $3.10). Strong growth upside via premiums/international; suits moderate risk (beta 1.1). Buy below $28 on dips.
